message: I'm going to buy a new hard drive for my laptop.  I'm thinking I have to buy the SSD. any advice?  W agebo mnen?

data.message: What is your laptop model ? it is depended on lot of things, like the max speed you gonna get benefit of, Conflict issues, and the operating system you gonna use
and Applications for sure, and if you gonna have another harddrive inside your laptop or not

My Hard drive needs replacement so I thought I'd I'm buying a new one muggt as well buy an ssd. 
My laptoo is dell inspiron 3521 i5 clocked at 1.8 with 8 gb of ram and 2gb ati graphics card.  I might be using graphics abd architecture applications like 3ds max photoshop abd revit .
A new hard drive that is not ssd will cost about 330 egp

Never get a non-SSD drive ... the mechanical (normal) ones days are over, the SSDs used to be unreliable but now the situation is reversed ... SSDs are getting cheaper by the moment and they deliver a huge performance improvement over normal ones.. the question is how much is your budget?

I would really recommend Samsung EVO (or Pro if you have the money), I got a Samsung 850 EVO 250 GB SSD last February, it cost 1400 EGP but it's perfect :)
I heard a lot of bad reviews about Kingston SSDs (they are the cheapest) so avoid them!

Samsung is the most recommended one, and it comes with a software that optimizes Windows to write less.
I think Samsung EVO 265GB costs 850LE

If you are buying for a PC, then you can get a 120GB one for the system, and put the rest of your less used files (movies or iso) on an HDD
If you have a good budget, then definitely go with SSD
